Larissa Feng
another developer with a website.

Reading List

“There are worse crimes than burning books.
One of them is not reading them.”
- Ray Bradbury

I read a lot. I read as much as I can. I read in an attempt to truly understand how the world and the beings within it work, which - given that nothing is mutually exclusive - means that I try read everything.

Current

  • Snow by Orhan Pamuk

2021

  • The Bell Jar by Sylvia Plath

2020

  • Pendragon #4: The Reality Bug by D.J. MacHale
  • Pendragon #3: The Never War by D.J. MacHale
  • Pendragon #2: The Lost City of Faar by D.J. MacHale
  • Pendragon #1: The Merchant of Death by D.J. MacHale
  • The Architecture of Happiness by Alain de Botton
  • Just Kids by Patti Smith *
  • Power games: a political history of the Olympics by Jules Boykoff
  • The State of Affairs: Rethinking Infidelity by Esther Perel *
  • In the Skin of a Lion by Michael Ondaatje *
  • From the Ashes: My Story of Being Métis, Homeless, and Finding My Way by Jesse Thistle
  • How Music Works by David Byrne
  • Swan Song (play) by Anton Chekhov
  • How Should a Person Be? by Sheila Heti
  • The Picture of Dorian Gray by Oscar Wilde *
  • Binti by Nnedi Okorafor
  • Confessions of a Microfinance Heretic by Hugh Sinclair
  • Superpower, Interrupted: The Chinese History of the World by Michael Schuman
  • Go Tell It on the Mountain by James Baldwin
  • The Discomfort Zone by Jonathan Franzen
  • Railsea by China Miéville
  • The Stranger by Albert Camus
  • Drive: The Surprising Truth About What Motivates Us by Daniel H. Pink
  • The Artist At Work (short story) by Albert Camus *
  • Axolotl (short story) by Julio Cortázar
  • All My Darling Daughters (short story) by Connie Willis
  • Writing Better Lyrics by Pat Pattison (unfinished for now, slowly working through the exercises in the book!)
  • The Tempest by William Shakespeare
  • The Lottery (short story) by Shirley Jackson
  • In the Penal Colony (short story) by Franz Kafka
  • Lemon by Cordelia Strube
  • On the Shores of Darkness, There Is Light by Cordelia Strube
  • I Hope We Choose Love: A Trans Girl’s Notes from the End of the World by Kai Cheng Thom *
  • The Stone Sky (The Broken Earth #3) by N.K. Jemisin
  • The Obelisk Gate (The Broken Earth #2) by N.K. Jemisin
  • Love Lives Here: A Story of Thriving in a Transgender Family by Amanda Jette Knox
  • The Fifth Season (The Broken Earth #1) by N.K. Jemisin

2019

  • Gingerbread by Helen Oyeyemi

  • No Place to Go: How Public Toilets Fail our Private Needs by Lezlie Lowe *
  • The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks by Rebecca Skloot
  • The Trouble with Brunch: Work, Class and the Pursuit of Leisure by Shawn Micallef
  • The Lathe of Heaven by Ursula K. Le Guin
  • Medical Monopoly: Intellectual Property Rights and the Origins of the Modern Pharmaceutical Industry by Joseph M. Gabriel (unfinished due to boredom)
  • Digital Minimalism: Choosing a Focused Life in a Noisy World by Cal Newport
